subject: Learning
title: Bottom-Up vs Top-Down Attention
description: Learn Bottom-Up vs Top-Down Attention in one minute.

hook.text: A loud bang makes you look. A chess player studies the board without any external trigger. Two systems.

buildup.text: Bottom-up attention is automaticâ€”triggered by sudden, salient stimuli in the environment.

discovery.text: Top-down attention is voluntaryâ€”you deliberately direct focus based on goals and intentions.

twist.text: They compete constantly. A notification (bottom-up) hijacks your essay writing (top-down) every time.

climax.text: Productivity depends on strengthening top-down control while minimizing bottom-up interruptions.

punchline.text: Your environment pulls attention. Your goals push it. Manage both.

quiz.question: What is the difference between bottom-up and top-down attention?
options: Bottom-up is automatic and stimulus-driven; top-down is voluntary and goal-driven
They are the same process with different names
